title: Cosmic Reaver Kassadin - Charitable Donation Update
body:
We wanted to give you all an update on the Cosmic Reaver Kassadin charity donation. My goal here is to give you guys more visibility into the process and let you know our progress to date. 

The process we are going through:
 
1. Identify the cause we want to contribute towards (done)
2. Identify potential organisations to partner with (done)
3. Vet organisations and identify potential projects the donation could go towards (in progress)
4. Work with the organisation to select where the donation makes the most sense (in progress)
5. Check up on progress/additional follow-up at needed (not started)

What we have done:
 
When looking at charity organisations we had couple of goals we wanted to achieve, some more important than others:

** MUST HAVE: **

*      The organisation needed to be in the field of “Medical” as this was chosen by the community
*      We wanted to organisation to impact both Australia and New Zealand
*      We wanted to organisation to be reputable and with track record of bringing results in their field

##SHOULD HAVE:##

*      The topic / subject of the charity relevant to “us” Oceanic players
*      We wanted the outcome of the organisation to be trackable

**NICE TO HAVE:**

*      We would rather work with a small organisation because they would not have many admin costs therefore the impact would be bigger
*      We would prefer not to split the money between Australia and New Zealand, again to increase the impact

Finding a charity which fulfilled all these goals was pretty hard (there are not many organisation that have impact in both Australia and New Zealand therefore we decided to split the money between the 2 regions). 

The charities that fulfilled the remaining goals were doing such great work that we didn’t want to eliminate them. We were able to narrow down the specific cause that we really wanted to contribute to, which enabled us to identify a few key organisations to vet. 

** Where we are at: **

We are actually working on step 3 and 4 concurrently at the moment. So we’re in discussions with organisations in New Zealand and Australia that are focused on Skin Cancer. Given the time of year and the importance of this cause in Oceania, we think it fits well and could really help a lot of people.

Once we’ve looked at the projects we can contribute to, we’re going to be splitting up our donation between two different organisations - one in New Zealand, and one in Australia. Our current plan is to split these up based on where the purchase of Cosmic Reaver Kassadin came from. 

We know this is taking a while and really wish that it could have all been completed by now, but our number one goal is to ensure that we do it right. Once we’ve gotten to a point with these organisations where we’ve identified what projects we’re going to contribute to, we’ll update this thread and sure you are all kept in the loop.

I think this should go towards something that not many people are aware of but is a rising issue through out both australia, new zealand and of course the world.

Endometriosis research / financial support to women whom have extreme cases, alot of these women are not covered by insurance, alot of them suffer in silence at home, out of sight from the world. 

What Is Endometriosis?
Endometriosis is a disorder in which the tissue that forms the lining of your uterus grows outside of your uterine cavity. The lining of your uterus is called the endometrium.

Endometriosis occurs when the endometrium grows on your ovaries, bowel, and tissues lining your pelvis. It’s unusual for endometrial tissue to spread beyond your pelvic region, but it’s not impossible. Endometrial tissue growing outside of your uterus is known as an endometrial implant.

The hormonal changes of your menstrual cycle affect the misplaced endometrial tissue. This means the tissue will grow, thicken, and break down. Over time, the tissue that has broken down has nowhere to go and becomes trapped in your pelvis.

This tissue trapped in your pelvis can cause:

irritation
scar formation
adhesions, in which tissue binds your pelvic organs together
severe pain during your periods
fertility problems
Endometriosis is a common gynecological condition. You’re not alone if you suffer from this disorder.


For those who want it simplified, its common to simplify it as; imagine the most painful period you've been around your partner for....
Multiply it by 100, instead of it being 3-5days a month, these pains can often last 2-3weeks at a time, it can affect appetite, self esteem, cause hormonal imbalances. 

It's time to look at the silent sufferers in our countries, as our governments barely recognize them as medical conditions. They aren't supported properly in hospitals through public systems, and people whom have had it are sick of the constant medication processes (codeine, endone shots, etc) often they are treating like drug abusers, made to wait hours on end before even being offered some Panadeine Forte. 

These women are our Mothers, Sisters, Partners, Daughters.... They suffer internally, and they do it being as strong as they can as to not impact the people around them, they're tired of being the reasons why the people they care for don't go out, get held back etc.

It often leads to anxiety, eating disorders, depression, weight fluctuations and depression (which can lead to suicide in some cases)

Just my 2cents.
